alerts.headline: squall watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots.

Additional gusty showers and thunderstorms are possible for the remainder of the evening. The threat for strong wind gusts is expected to diminish overnight.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Mariners are advised to prepare for potential squalls. Vulnerable vessels are most at risk and should seek safe harbour if underway.

alerts.headline: freezing rain warning ended
alerts.description:
Freezing rain conditions are no longer expected.


###

alerts.headline: squall watch ended
alerts.description:
Squalls are no longer expected over the area.


###

alerts.headline: squall watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots.

Thunderstorms are expected to develop over Michigan and track over the area later this evening. Thunderstorms are expected to weaken early Saturday morning.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots and frequent lightning are expected or occurring in the area.

An area of showers and thunderstorms is moving northeast across the lake at 35 knots.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Vessels without lightning protection should make their way to shore immediately. Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately. Consider delaying or postponing travel in areas under the squall warning.

alerts.headline: squall watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots, frequent lightning and poor to very poor visibility in thunderstorms heavy at times.

Thunderstorms are expected to develop over Michigan and track over the area  later this evening. The squall threat should end by Saturday morning.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Vessels without lightning protection should make their way to shore immediately.

alerts.headline: squall watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots, frequent lightning and poor to very poor visibility in showers heavy at times.

Thunderstorms are expected to track northeast across the area over the next few hours. The squall threat should end this morning.

###

Proceed with caution as visibility may suddenly be reduced to near zero.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Vessels without lightning protection should make their way to shore immediately. Mariners are advised to prepare for potential squalls. Vulnerable vessels are most at risk and should seek safe harbour if underway. Consider delaying or postponing travel in areas under the Squall Watch.

Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots, frequent lightning and poor to very poor visibility in showers heavy at times.

Thunderstorms are expected to track northeast across the area over the next few hours. The squall threat should end this morning.

###

Proceed with caution as visibility may suddenly be reduced to near zero.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Vessels without lightning protection should make their way to shore immediately. Mariners are advised to prepare for potential squalls. Vulnerable vessels are most at risk and should seek safe harbour if underway. Consider delaying or postponing travel in areas under the Squall Watch.

alerts.headline: squall watch ended
alerts.description:
Squalls are no longer expected over the area.


###

alerts.headline: freezing rain warning in effect
alerts.description:
Ice build-up due to freezing rain tonight.

What:
Long duration freezing rain. 
2 to 5 mm of ice accretion.

When:
Freezing rain mixed with rain or snow will end by Saturday morning.

Additional information:
Freezing rain mixed with rain or snow will continue tonight. While the freezing rain is expected to remain light, the long duration means that ice accretion of up to 5 mm is possible. Freezing rain is expected to change over to ice pellets or snow early Saturday morning.

Surfaces such as walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and hazardous.

Beware of electrical wires that could break under the weight of ice.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
